What crops is this useful for?: The pesticide is useful for terrestrial food crop, terrestrial food/feed crop, terrestrial nonfood crop, aquatic nonfood outdoor, forestry, residential outdoor, indoor nonfood, and indoor residential.
First aid information?: If swallowed, do not drink water or induce vomiting unless told by a doctor. If on skin or clothing, rinse with water for 15-20 minutes. If inhaled, move person to fresh air and give artificial respiration if needed. If in eyes, rinse with water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center, doctor, or 1-800-498-5743 immediately for treatment advice.
What special restrictions are placed on: The pesticide is extremely toxic to fish and wildlife. It should not be discharged into waters or sewer systems unless in accordance with the requirements of a National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit and the permitting authority has been notified in writing prior to discharge.
What PPE should I wear?: Use dust/mist filtering respirator (MSHA/NIOSH approval number prefix TC-21C) or a NIOSH approved respirator with any N, R, P, or HE filter. Do not get in eyes, on skin or on clothing.
How does the product have to be stored o: Store only in original container in a cool, dry place inaccessible to children and pets. Keep containers closed and away from other chemicals. Wastes resulting from the use of this product, and spoiled and unconsumed bait, may be disposed of on site or at an approved waste disposal facility.
